title: Death rate from ambient particulate air pollution vs. GDP per capita
subtitle: Deaths attributed to exposure to outdoor particulate air pollution, measured as the number of premature deaths per 100,000 people versus gross domestic product (GDP) per capita, measured in constant international-$. Death rates are age-standardized, so correct for differences in age structures between populations.

display.name: Deaths from ambient particulate air pollution

sourceDesc: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2019); Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
